Html:
Hi

I like to use a hyperlink column (for non uri content) and I want to define what happens on the click of the link.

How can I achieve this?

Regards
klaus

Hi

seems that I am not the only one ;-)

But: it does not compile on my system either, I get an other error during build:
Error    3    'eventSetter' is a type and cannot be used as an expression.    D:\Blending\01_Software\01_Master\6100\Source\Infor.Blending.Admin\Infor.Blending.Admin.Client\obj\Debug\UserControls\Modules.g.vb    227    Infor.Blending.Admin.Client
Regards
Klaus
Can you show a code snippet of the place where you are getting this error.

Hi

I just copied the xaml from the thread you mentioned:

<dg:DataGridHyperlinkColumn Header="Homepage" CanUserSort="False" Binding="{Binding Path=ModuleName}">
    <dg:DataGridHyperlinkColumn.ElementStyle>
        <Style TargetType="TextBlock">
            <EventSetter Event="Hyperlink.Click" Handler="dgData_DetailsButton_Click" />
        </Style>
    </dg:DataGridHyperlinkColumn.ElementStyle>
</dg:DataGridHyperlinkColumn>

During compile time, I get the error

Regards
Klaus
I followed the code at the beginning of the thread, http://www.codeplex.com/wpf/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=37127, and didn't have any issues.  What does your dgData_DetailsButton_Click look like?

Vincent

I just tried to separate the problem in a demo project, and there I do not have a problem.

When I try to use the same xaml and handler in my bigger development project I get the build error below.

The Xaml is
dg:DataGridHyperlinkColumn Header="Homepage" CanUserSort="False" Binding="{Binding Path=ModuleName}">
dg:DataGridHyperlinkColumn.ElementStyle>
Style TargetType="TextBlock">
EventSetter Event="Hyperlink.Click" Handler="dgData_DetailsButton_Click" />
Style>
dg:DataGridHyperlinkColumn.ElementStyle>
dg:DataGridHyperlinkColumn>

The line 130 of modules.xaml is EventSetter Event="Hyperlink.Click" Handler="dgData_DetailsButton_Click" />,

The handler is

Private Sub dgData_DetailsButton_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs)
MsgBox("hi")
End Sub

I get the following errors, if I comment the xaml snippet all is fine.
Maybe my solution is kind of messed up? I already cleaned but no help

Thanks for your support
Klaus

Error 1 Reference to a non-shared member requires an object reference. D:\Blending\01_Software\01_Master\6100\UserControls\Modules.xaml 130 Infor.Blending.Admin.Client
